name: Ruihong Huang
content: Huang, Ruihong | Texas A&M University Engineering Skip To Main Content Skip To Profile Details Skip To Educational Background Skip To Research Interests Skip To Selected Publications Associate Professor, Computer Science & Engineering Phone: 979-862-2908 Email: huangrh@tamu.edu Office: PETR 328 Website: Personal Website Google Scholar Profile Educational Background Ph.D., Computer Science, University of Utah, 2014 M.S., Computer Science, Chinese Academy of Sciences, 2008 B.E., Computer Science and Engineering, Shandong University, 2005 Research Interests Natural language processing (NLP) Information extraction Machine learning Artificial intelligence Digital humanities Selected Publications Ruihong Huang and Ellen Riloff, "Multi-faceted Event Recognition with Bootstrapped Dictionaries," In Proceedings of the Conference of the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics (NAACL-13), Atlanta, USA, 2013. Ruihong Huang and Ellen Riloff, "Modeling Textual Cohesion for Event Extraction," In Proceedings of the 26th National Conference on Artificial Intelligence (AAAI-12), Toronto, Ontario, Canada, 2012. Ruihong Huang and Ellen Riloff, "Bootstrapped Training of Event Extraction Classifiers," In Proceedings of the 13th Conference of the European Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics (EACL-12), Avignon, France, 2012. Ruihong Huang and Ellen Riloff, "Peeling Back the Layers: Detecting Event Role Fillers in Secondary Contexts," In Proceedings of The 49th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL-11), Portland, Oregon, USA, 2011. Ruihong Huang and Ellen Riloff, "Inducing Domain-specific Semantic Class Taggers from (Almost) Nothing," In Proceedings of The 48th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL-10), Uppsala, Sweden, 2010.
